reviews.title: Hellsten has it!
reviews.text: We loved Hellsten! From the beautiful and romantic entry to the lovely, quiet room with a great courtyard view. THe location was great; close to a t-bana stop, city bikes station and the main N/S road for walking. We did all three during our trip. The breakfast room was pleasant and I enjoyed the waffles! The staff was friendly and helpful and kept with the romantic ambiance. I was so impressed that a hotel that Samantha Brown stayed in for a Passport to Europe episode was affordable enough for a regular couple like us. We loved it and would stay again in a hearbeat!!

reviews.title: Interesting four star hotel
reviews.text: After booking a room at the sister hotel Rex we were moved to the Hellsten and upgraded.

reviews.title: Boutique hotel with friendly staff
reviews.text: The room was very large but in the basement (only a tiny window at the top of the room). (The hotel also has rooms on higher levels.) The design was very modern and stylish and the room was very clean. We had a huge comfy bed and a large TV. The bathroom contained a finnish sauna and looked new, but actually started to fall apart in several places (the toilet seat was loose, the fan wasn't working and the shower couldn't be adjusted to a fixed positon). The shower had no cabin or curtain so it showered the whole bathroom.

reviews.title: Super!!!
reviews.text: The location is located in a very quiet street north of the city center in walking distance (20 minutes) of the main attractions, but there are shops and restaurants nearby.

reviews.title: SMALL ROOMS ,BUT HOTEL WITH AMBIANCE
reviews.text: The breakfast room was too small, it was extremely crowded and we were lucky to find a table because other guests were just leaving. The breakfast itself was very good with selections of different breads, meats, cheeses, waffles, eggs, cereal and various choices of tea.

reviews.title: Charming, but not a four-star
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hellsten hotel for two nights during a short visit to Stockholm. The hotel is charming, no doubt, with authentic furniture, individually-decorated rooms, wooden floors and a trendy atmosphere. However, it is definitely not a four-star hotel. The room we stayed in was relatively small. It had no safe, no fridge. The bathroom had only two small shelves, not enough space to put any of our toiletries. There were no tissues and the towels were only medium-sized. Breakfast was OK, but not of four-star standard.

reviews.title: Lovely little hotel with great service
reviews.text: The Hellsten is a little gem of a hotel. I arrived at the Hellsten at 8am on a Monday morning with a bout of food poisoning, and the receptionist ensured I got the first room made available that morning.

reviews.title: Met all our needs.
reviews.text: The room was a charming attic room with beams and thoughtfully decorated. The bathroom was quite trendy - but I'm still unsure as to whether water was meant to leak out of the bottom of the shower door (a la wetroom) or not.

reviews.title: Trendy!
reviews.text: Free wifi and a varied self-service breakfast were great extras.

reviews.title: Feeling like you're at home!
reviews.text: There is little communal space - I stayed at the same time as a 20-strong delegation of young people, and was relegated to the entrance hall on a comfy bench while they took over the other areas.

reviews.title: Great place to stay in Stockholm
reviews.text: This is well run and friendly hotel with a relaxing atmosphere. We arrived late in the evening during a general power cut (very rare for Stockholm we were told) and with all the hotel's computer systems up the spout. It was a while before a bedroom could be sorted out for us but we were taken to the bar where candles were lit and complimentary drinks provided. Top marks for managing in a crisis!

reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else!
reviews.text: The hotel itself is in a quiet street yet very close to a tube stop and is just a 25 minute pleasant walk to the city centre if you are in the mood. All the furnishings in the hotel complement the beautiful old building. The dining room is set around a central courtyard with an indoor conservatory area and a few outdoor tables and chairs as well.

reviews.title: Good service, good location, good room
reviews.text: Breakfast is an excellent Swedish buffet (with great porridge as well!) but it did get very crowded at peak morning service. The only other tiny criticism was a lack of hanging space in the bedroom, but overall this is a great place to stay.

reviews.title: Gem of a hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Hellsten for two nights during Mid-Summer. It was fantastic! It is a fantastic boutique style hotel with beautiful, warm, cozy, romantic (can I put any more good words here?) rooms and common areas. The front desk attendants were incredibly helpful and gave lots of advice for things to do, offered to make dinner reservations for us, and arranged to have a packed breakfast ready for us before we left for our early flight. We were given a free upgrade to the suite (no idea why, but didn't complain!) and were flabbergasted. We even had a personal lava rock sauna. The only downfall of this hotel is it is a bit of walk from the old town center or touristy areas...it took us 20-30 minutes to make the trip, but it was a nice walk. There are two other hotels in the same family right across the street (Rex Hotel and Rex Petit) that looked just as nice, but with smaller rooms and a smaller price. We would also have stayed at either of these.

reviews.title: not bad - but quite far away from four stars!!!
reviews.text: Location of Hotel Hellsten is good. There are restaurants and shops along Sveavagen nearby the hotel. Hotel staff are polite and helpful with information. Service at breakfast was efficient. Although there were many guests when I stayed, the staff ensured that the tables are cleared quickly and that food is always available. Tea and coffee is available on self-service in the lounge. There are also two computers with internet connection and a connected printer (with printing paper). The single room I stayed in was a good size and had a soft and very comfortable 4-poster bed. My 4-night stay was very pleasant.
Beautiful Hotel with Stunning rooms, Friendly staff & Great atmosphere. Breakfast was delicous! Short walk into Stockholm city centre! Love it!!! A****

reviews.title: HELLSTEN HOTEL STOCKHOLM - HIDDEN LITTLE GEM!!
reviews.text: We stayed in Stockholm in early January and booked this hotel through the recommendation of a friend and certainly did not get disappointed.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great location.
reviews.text: We booked a Junior Suite for 4 nights.

reviews.title: nice hotel, but a small room
reviews.text: Apart from a rude male receptionist when we checked in, the hotel was faultless.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, traditional decor
reviews.text: The room was extremely large and decorated with beautiful antiques and the bathroom modern.
